alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cumberland and Prince Edward Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hixburg to near Mike to near Long Island. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Farmville, Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University, Darlington Heights, Rice, Green Bay, Prospect, Raines Tavern, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Angola, Briery, Twin Lakes State Park, Hawk, Kingsville, Elam, Worsham, Briery Creek Lake and Allens Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
